title: The Dark Knight
stars: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart
overview: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

title: Inception
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Elliot Page
overview: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
stars: Elijah Wood, Ian McKellen, Orlando Bloom
overview: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
stars: Elijah Wood, Viggo Mortensen, Ian McKellen
overview: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

title: Interstellar
stars: Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway, Jessica Chastain
overview: A team of explorers travel through a wormhole in space in an attempt to ensure humanity's survival.

title: The Dark Knight Rises
stars: Christian Bale, Tom Hardy, Anne Hathaway
overview: Eight years after the Joker's reign of anarchy, Batman, with the help of the enigmatic Catwoman, is forced from his exile to save Gotham City from the brutal guerrilla terrorist Bane.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
stars: Elijah Wood, Ian McKellen, Viggo Mortensen
overview: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

title: Django Unchained
stars: Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio
overview: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation-owner in Mississippi.

title: Gladiator
stars: Russell Crowe, Joaquin Phoenix, Connie Nielsen
overview: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

title: Batman Begins
stars: Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Ken Watanabe
overview: After training with his mentor, Batman begins his fight to free crime-ridden Gotham City from corruption.

title: Inglourious Basterds
stars: Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger, Eli Roth
overview: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

title: The Avengers
stars: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson
overview: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie
overview: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

title: The Prestige
stars: Christian Bale, Hugh Jackman, Scarlett Johansson
overview: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians in 1890s London engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.

title: The Departed
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson
overview: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

title: Shutter Island
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Emily Mortimer, Mark Ruffalo
overview: In 1954, a U.S. Marshal investigates the disappearance of a murderer who escaped from a hospital for the criminally insane.

title: Memento
stars: Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano
overview: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

title: Avatar
stars: Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver
overview: A paraplegic Marine dispatched to the moon Pandora on a unique mission becomes torn between following his orders and protecting the world he feels is his home.

title: Joker
stars: Joaquin Phoenix, Robert De Niro, Zazie Beetz
overview: In Gotham City, mentally troubled comedian Arthur Fleck is disregarded and mistreated by society. He then embarks on a downward spiral of revolution and bloody crime. This path brings him face-to-face with his alter-ego: the Joker.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy
stars: Chris Pratt, Vin Diesel, Bradley Cooper
overview: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

title: V for Vendetta
stars: Hugo Weaving, Natalie Portman, Rupert Graves
overview: In a future British tyranny, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V," plots to overthrow it with the help of a young woman.

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
stars: Uma Thurman, David Carradine, Daryl Hannah
overview: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.

title: WALL·E
stars: Ben Burtt, Elissa Knight, Jeff Garlin
overview: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
stars: Johnny Depp, Geoffrey Rush, Orlando Bloom
overview: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

title: Iron Man
stars: Robert Downey Jr., Gwyneth Paltrow, Terrence Howard
overview: After being held captive in an Afghan cave, billionaire engineer Tony Stark creates a unique weaponized suit of armor to fight evil.

title: Finding Nemo
stars: Lee Unkrich, Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres
overview: After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.

title: Up
stars: Bob Peterson, Ed Asner, Jordan Nagai
overview: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

title: Avengers: Endgame
stars: Joe Russo, Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans
overview: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe.

title: Deadpool
stars: Ryan Reynolds, Morena Baccarin, T.J. Miller
overview: A wisecracking mercenary gets experimented on and becomes immortal but ugly, and sets out to track down the man who ruined his looks.

title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
stars: Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Tom Wilkinson
overview: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.

title: Avengers: Infinity War
stars: Joe Russo, Robert Downey Jr., Chris Hemsworth
overview: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

title: Mad Max: Fury Road
stars: Tom Hardy, Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult
overview: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper, and a drifter named Max.

title: Gone Girl
stars: Ben Affleck, Rosamund Pike, Neil Patrick Harris
overview: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

title: No Country for Old Men
stars: Joel Coen, Tommy Lee Jones, Javier Bardem
overview: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

title: Catch Me If You Can
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken
overview: Barely 21 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

title: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens
stars: Daisy Ridley, John Boyega, Oscar Isaac
overview: As a new threat to the galaxy rises, Rey, a desert scavenger, and Finn, an ex-stormtrooper, must join Han Solo and Chewbacca to search for the one hope of restoring peace.

title: A Beautiful Mind
stars: Russell Crowe, Ed Harris, Jennifer Connelly
overview: After John Nash, a brilliant but asocial mathematician, accepts secret work in cryptography, his life takes a turn for the nightmarish.

title: The Hunger Games
stars: Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, Liam Hemsworth
overview: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

title: Monsters, Inc.
stars: David Silverman, Lee Unkrich, Billy Crystal
overview: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

title: Slumdog Millionaire
stars: Loveleen Tandan, Dev Patel, Freida Pinto
overview: A Mumbai teenager reflects on his life after being accused of cheating on the Indian version of "Who Wants to be a Millionaire?".

title: Snatch
stars: Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Stephen Graham
overview: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
overview: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

title: The Intouchables
stars: Éric Toledano, François Cluzet, Omar Sy
overview: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

title: The Martian
stars: Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig
overview: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive and can survive until a potential rescue.

title: Avengers: Age of Ultron
stars: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo
overview: When Tony Stark and Bruce Banner try to jump-start a dormant peacekeeping program called Ultron, things go horribly wrong and it's up to Earth's mightiest heroes to stop the villainous Ultron from enacting his terrible plan.

title: Iron Man Three
stars: Robert Downey Jr., Guy Pearce, Gwyneth Paltrow
overview: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.

title: Requiem for a Dream
stars: Ellen Burstyn, Jared Leto, Jennifer Connelly
overview: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep.

title: Gravity
stars: Sandra Bullock, George Clooney, Ed Harris
overview: Two astronauts work together to survive after an accident leaves them stranded in space.

title: Captain America: The First Avenger
stars: Chris Evans, Hugo Weaving, Samuel L. Jackson
overview: Steve Rogers, a rejected military soldier, transforms into Captain America after taking a dose of a "Super-Soldier serum". But being Captain America comes at a price as he attempts to take down a war monger and a terrorist organization.

title: Thor
stars: Chris Hemsworth, Anthony Hopkins, Natalie Portman
overview: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.

title: Toy Story 3
stars: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Joan Cusack
overview: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
stars: Joe Russo, Chris Evans, Samuel L. Jackson
overview: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.

title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
stars: Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage
overview: A reluctant Hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home, and the gold within it from the dragon Smaug.

title: The Pianist
stars: Adrien Brody, Thomas Kretschmann, Frank Finlay
overview: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

title: Whiplash
stars: Miles Teller, J.K. Simmons, Melissa Benoist
overview: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

title: Iron Man 2
stars: Robert Downey Jr., Mickey Rourke, Gwyneth Paltrow
overview: With the world now aware of his identity as Iron Man, Tony Stark must contend with both his declining health and a vengeful mad man with ties to his father's legacy.

title: Donnie Darko
stars: Jake Gyllenhaal, Jena Malone, Mary McDonnell
overview: After narrowly escaping a bizarre accident, a troubled teenager is plagued by visions of a man in a large rabbit suit who manipulates him to commit a series of crimes.

stars: Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, David Wenham
overview: King Leonidas of Sparta and a force of 300 men fight the Persians at Thermopylae in 480 B.C.

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
stars: Ralph Fiennes, F. Murray Abraham, Mathieu Amalric
overview: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

title: Spider-Man
stars: Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe
overview: When bitten by a genetically modified spider, a nerdy, shy, and awkward high school student gains spider-like abilities that he eventually must use to fight evil as a superhero after tragedy befalls his family.

title: The Revenant
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hardy, Will Poulter
overview: A frontiersman on a fur trading expedition in the 1820s fights for survival after being mauled by a bear and left for dead by members of his own hunting team.

title: Sin City
stars: Quentin Tarantino, Robert Rodriguez, Mickey Rourke
overview: An exploration of the dark and miserable Basin City and three of its residents, all of whom are caught up in violent corruption.

title: The Hangover
stars: Zach Galifianakis, Bradley Cooper, Justin Bartha
overview: Three buddies wake up from a bachelor party in Las Vegas, with no memory of the previous night and the bachelor missing. They make their way around the city in order to find their friend before his wedding.

title: Gran Torino
stars: Clint Eastwood, Bee Vang, Christopher Carley
overview: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbor, Thao Lor, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: a 1972 Gran Torino.

title: Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
stars: Hayden Christensen, Natalie Portman, Ewan McGregor
overview: Three years into the Clone Wars, the Jedi rescue Palpatine from Count Dooku. As Obi-Wan pursues a new threat, Anakin acts as a double agent between the Jedi Council and Palpatine and is lured into a sinister plan to rule the galaxy.

title: Man of Steel
stars: Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon
overview: An alien child is evacuated from his dying world and sent to Earth to live among humans. His peace is threatened, when other survivors of his home planet invade Earth.

title: Black Swan
stars: Natalie Portman, Mila Kunis, Vincent Cassel
overview: A committed dancer struggles to maintain her sanity after winning the lead role in a production of Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake".

title: Le fabuleux destin d'Amélie Poulain
stars: Audrey Tautou, Mathieu Kassovitz, Rufus
overview: Amélie is an innocent and naive girl in Paris with her own sense of justice. She decides to help those around her and, along the way, discovers love.

title: Cidade de Deus
stars: Kátia Lund, Alexandre Rodrigues, Leandro Firmino
overview: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.

title: The Imitation Game
stars: Benedict Cumberbatch, Keira Knightley, Matthew Goode
overview: During World War II, the English mathematical genius Alan Turing tries to crack the German Enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians while attempting to come to terms with his troubled private life.

title: Captain America: Civil War
stars: Joe Russo, Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr.
overview: Political involvement in the Avengers' affairs causes a rift between Captain America and Iron Man.

title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
stars: Uma Thurman, David Carradine, Michael Madsen
overview: The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.

title: I Am Legend
stars: Will Smith, Alice Braga, Charlie Tahan
overview: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Richard Harris
overview: An orphaned boy enrolls in a school of wizardry, where he learns the truth about himself, his family and the terrible evil that haunts the magical world.

title: Sen to Chihiro no kamikakushi
stars: Daveigh Chase, Suzanne Pleshette, Miyu Irino
overview: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches, and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

title: Logan

overview: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.

title: How to Train Your Dragon
stars: Chris Sanders, Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler
overview: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.

title: Gisaengchung
stars: Kang-ho Song, Sun-kyun Lee, Yeo-jeong Cho
overview: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

title: Black Panther
stars: Chadwick Boseman, Michael B. Jordan, Lupita Nyong'o
overview: T'Challa, heir to the hidden but advanced kingdom of Wakanda, must step forward to lead his people into a new future and must confront a challenger from his country's past.

title: The Incredibles
stars: Craig T. Nelson, Samuel L. Jackson, Holly Hunter
overview: A family of undercover superheroes, while trying to live the quiet suburban life, are forced into action to save the world.

title: Silver Linings Playbook
stars: Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro
overview: After a stint in a mental institution, former teacher Pat Solitano moves back in with his parents and tries to reconcile with his ex-wife. Things get more challenging when Pat meets Tiffany, a mysterious girl with problems of her own.

title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
stars: Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Hugh Jackman
overview: The X-Men send Wolverine to the past in a desperate effort to change history and prevent an event that results in doom for both humans and mutants.

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
stars: Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley
overview: Jack Sparrow races to recover the heart of Davy Jones to avoid enslaving his soul to Jones' service, as other friends and foes seek the heart for their own agenda as well.

title: Ratatouille
stars: Jan Pinkava, Brad Garrett, Lou Romano
overview: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.

title: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones
stars: Hayden Christensen, Natalie Portman, Ewan McGregor
overview: Ten years after initially meeting, Anakin Skywalker shares a forbidden romance with Padmé Amidala, while Obi-Wan Kenobi investigates an assassination attempt on the senator and discovers a secret clone army crafted for the Jedi.

title: Skyfall
stars: Daniel Craig, Javier Bardem, Naomie Harris
overview: James Bond's loyalty to M is tested when her past comes back to haunt her. When MI6 comes under attack, 007 must track down and destroy the threat, no matter how personal the cost.

title: 12 Years a Slave
stars: Chiwetel Ejiofor, Michael Kenneth Williams, Michael Fassbender
overview: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
stars: Ben Affleck, Henry Cavill, Amy Adams
overview: Fearing that the actions of Superman are left unchecked, Batman takes on the Man of Steel, while the world wrestles with what kind of a hero it really needs.

title: X: First Class
stars: James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender, Jennifer Lawrence
overview: In the 1960s, superpowered humans Charles Xavier and Erik Lensherr work together to find others like them, but Erik's vengeful pursuit of an ambitious mutant who ruined his life causes a schism to divide them.

title: Thor: Ragnarok

overview: Imprisoned on the planet Sakaar, Thor must race against time to return to Asgard and stop Ragnarök, the destruction of his world, at the hands of the powerful and ruthless villain Hela.

title: The Social Network
stars: Jesse Eisenberg, Andrew Garfield, Justin Timberlake
overview: As Harvard student Mark Zuckerberg creates the social networking site that would become known as Facebook, he is sued by the twins who claimed he stole their idea, and by the co-founder who was later squeezed out of the business.

title: Doctor Strange
stars: Benedict Cumberbatch, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Rachel McAdams
overview: While on a journey of physical and spiritual healing, a brilliant neurosurgeon is drawn into the world of the mystic arts.

title: Million Dollar Baby
stars: Hilary Swank, Clint Eastwood, Morgan Freeman
overview: A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional.

title: The King's Speech
stars: Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter
overview: The story of King George VI, his impromptu ascension to the throne of the British Empire in 1936, and the speech therapist who helped the unsure monarch overcome his stammer.

title: District 9
stars: Sharlto Copley, David James, Jason Cope
overview: Violence ensues after an extraterrestrial race forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth finds a kindred spirit in a government agent exposed to their biotechnology.

title: Suicide Squad
stars: Will Smith, Jared Leto, Margot Robbie
overview: A secret government agency recruits some of the most dangerous incarcerated super-villains to form a defensive task force. Their first mission: save the world from the apocalypse.

title: Once Upon a Time in... Hollywood
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie
overview: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles.

title: Prisoners
stars: Hugh Jackman, Jake Gyllenhaal, Viola Davis
overview: When Keller Dover's daughter and her friend go missing, he takes matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts.

title: Arrival
stars: Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner, Forest Whitaker
overview: A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world.

title: Shrek
stars: Vicky Jenson, Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy
overview: A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.

title: Pan's Labyrinth
stars: Ivana Baquero, Ariadna Gil, Sergi López
overview: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

title: Edge of Tomorrow
stars: Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt, Bill Paxton
overview: A soldier fighting aliens gets to relive the same day over and over again, the day restarting every time he dies.

title: Thor: The Dark World
stars: Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Tom Hiddleston
overview: When the Dark Elves attempt to plunge the universe into darkness, Thor must embark on a perilous and personal journey that will reunite him with doctor Jane Foster.

title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
stars: Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, Liam Hemsworth
overview: Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark become targets of the Capitol after their victory in the 74th Hunger Games sparks a rebellion in the Districts of Panem.

title: World War Z
stars: Brad Pitt, Mireille Enos, Daniella Kertesz
overview: Former United Nations employee Gerry Lane traverses the world in a race against time to stop a zombie pandemic that is toppling armies and governments and threatens to destroy humanity itself.

title: Casino Royale
stars: Daniel Craig, Eva Green, Judi Dench
overview: After earning 00 status and a licence to kill, secret agent James Bond sets out on his first mission as 007. Bond must defeat a private banker funding terrorists in a high-stakes game of poker at Casino Royale, Montenegro.

title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
stars: Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage
overview: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring.

title: Now You See Me
stars: Jesse Eisenberg, Common, Mark Ruffalo
overview: An F.B.I. Agent and an Interpol Detective track a team of illusionists who pull off bank heists during their performances, and reward their audiences with the money.

title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
stars: Colin Firth, Taron Egerton, Samuel L. Jackson
overview: A spy organisation recruits a promising street kid into the agency's training program, while a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
stars: Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Dave Bautista
overview: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father the ambitious celestial being Ego.

title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
stars: Brad Pitt, Cate Blanchett, Tilda Swinton
overview: Tells the story of Benjamin Button, a man who starts aging backwards with consequences.

title: Ant-Man
stars: Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas, Corey Stoll
overview: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, pull off a plan that will save the world.

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
stars: Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley
overview: Captain Barbossa, Will Turner and Elizabeth Swann must sail off the edge of the map, navigate treachery and betrayal, find Jack Sparrow, and make their final alliances for one last decisive battle.

title: Wonder Woman
stars: Gal Gadot, Chris Pine, Robin Wright
overview: When a pilot crashes and tells of conflict in the outside world, Diana, an Amazonian warrior in training, leaves home to fight a war, discovering her full powers and true destiny.

title: The Bourne Ultimatum
stars: Matt Damon, Edgar Ramírez, Joan Allen
overview: Jason Bourne dodges a ruthless C.I.A. official and his Agents from a new assassination program while searching for the origins of his life as a trained killer.

title: Transformers
stars: Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel
overview: An ancient struggle between two Cybertronian races, the heroic Autobots and the evil Decepticons, comes to Earth, with a clue to the ultimate power held by a teenager.

title: Dunkirk
stars: Fionn Whitehead, Barry Keoghan, Mark Rylance
overview: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Commonwealth and Empire, and France are surrounded by the German Army and evacuated during a fierce battle in World War II.

title: Sherlock Holmes
stars: Robert Downey Jr., Jude Law, Rachel McAdams
overview: Detective Sherlock Holmes and his stalwart partner Watson engage in a battle of wits and brawn with a nemesis whose plot is a threat to all of England.

title: The Amazing Spider-Man
stars: Andrew Garfield, Emma Stone, Rhys Ifans
overview: After Peter Parker is bitten by a genetically altered spider, he gains newfound, spider-like powers and ventures out to save the city from the machinations of a mysterious reptilian foe.

title: Jurassic World
stars: Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Ty Simpkins
overview: A new theme park, built on the original site of Jurassic Park, creates a genetically modified hybrid dinosaur, the Indominus Rex, which escapes containment and goes on a killing spree.

title: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
stars: Michael Keaton, Zach Galifianakis, Edward Norton
overview: A washed-up superhero actor attempts to revive his fading career by writing, directing, and starring in a Broadway production.

title: Life of Pi
stars: Suraj Sharma, Irrfan Khan, Adil Hussain
overview: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

title: Spider-Man 2
stars: Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Alfred Molina
overview: Peter Parker is beset with troubles in his failing personal life as he battles a brilliant scientist named Doctor Otto Octavius.

title: Drive
stars: Ryan Gosling, Carey Mulligan, Bryan Cranston
overview: An action drama about a mysterious Hollywood stuntman and mechanic who moonlights as a getaway driver, and finds himself in trouble when he helps out his neighbor.

title: Into the Wild
stars: Emile Hirsch, Vince Vaughn, Catherine Keener
overview: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

title: Frozen
stars: Jennifer Lee, Kristen Bell, Idina Menzel
overview: When the newly crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister Anna teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condition.

title: Star Wars: Episode VIII - The Last Jedi
stars: Daisy Ridley, John Boyega, Mark Hamill
overview: The Star Wars saga continues as new heroes and galactic legends go on an epic adventure, unlocking mysteries of the Force and shocking revelations of the past.

title: Argo
stars: Ben Affleck, Bryan Cranston, John Goodman
overview: Acting under the cover of a Hollywood producer scouting a location for a science fiction film, a CIA agent launches a dangerous operation to rescue six Americans in Tehran during the U.S. hostage crisis in Iran in 1979.

stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson
overview: An ancient prophecy seems to be coming true when a mysterious presence begins stalking the corridors of a school of magic and leaving its victims paralyzed.

title: X-Men
stars: Patrick Stewart, Hugh Jackman, Ian McKellen
overview: In a world where mutants (evolved super-powered humans) exist and are discriminated against, two groups form for an inevitable clash: the supremacist Brotherhood, and the pacifist X-Men.

title: Star Trek
stars: Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Simon Pegg
overview: The brash James T. Kirk tries to live up to his father's legacy with Mr. Spock keeping him in check as a vengeful Romulan from the future creates black holes to destroy the Federation one planet at a time.

title: Prometheus
stars: Noomi Rapace, Logan Marshall-Green, Michael Fassbender

title: Rogue One
stars: Felicity Jones, Diego Luna, Alan Tudyk
overview: In a time of conflict, a group of unlikely heroes band together on a mission to steal the plans to the Death Star, the Empire's ultimate weapon of destruction.

title: John Wick
stars: David Leitch, Keanu Reeves, Michael Nyqvist
overview: An ex-hit-man comes out of retirement to track down the gangsters that killed his dog and took everything from him.

title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
stars: Tom Holland, Michael Keaton, Robert Downey Jr.
overview: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
overview: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

title: Taken
stars: Liam Neeson, Maggie Grace, Famke Janssen
overview: A retired CIA agent travels across Europe and relies on his old skills to save his estranged daughter, who has been kidnapped while on a trip to Paris.

title: Her
stars: Joaquin Phoenix, Amy Adams, Scarlett Johansson

title: The Matrix Reloaded
stars: Lilly Wachowski, Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne

title: Cast Away
stars: Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Paul Sanchez

title: The Hateful Eight
stars: Samuel L. Jackson, Kurt Russell, Jennifer Jason Leigh
overview: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

title: Knives Out
stars: Daniel Craig, Chris Evans, Ana de Armas

title: Looper

stars: Daniel Day-Lewis, Paul Dano, Ciarán Hinds

title: Superbad

stars: Choi Min-sik, Yoo Ji-Tae, Kang Hye-jeong

title: Spider-Man 3
stars: Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Topher Grace

title: The Notebook

title: Ocean's Eleven
stars: George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
overview: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

title: American Psycho
stars: Christian Bale, Justin Theroux, Josh Lucas

stars: Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, Kate Ashfield

title: 21 Jump Street
stars: Christopher Miller, Jonah Hill, Channing Tatum

title: Deadpool 2

overview: Foul-mouthed mutant mercenary Wade Wilson (a.k.a. Deadpool) assembles a team of fellow mutant rogues to protect a young boy with supernatural abilities from the brutal, time-traveling cyborg Cable.

stars: Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton
overview: In a future where a special police unit is able to arrest murderers before they commit their crimes, an officer from that unit is himself accused of a future murder.

title: X2
stars: Patrick Stewart, Hugh Jackman, Halle Berry

title: Watchmen

title: The Bourne Identity
stars: Franka Potente, Matt Damon, Chris Cooper
overview: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

title: Blood Diamond
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Djimon Hounsou, Jennifer Connelly
overview: A fisherman, a smuggler, and a syndicate of businessmen match wits over the possession of a priceless diamond.

title: Despicable Me
stars: Chris Renaud, Steve Carell, Jason Segel
overview: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.

title: I, Robot
stars: Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan, Bruce Greenwood

title: Blade Runner 2049
stars: Harrison Ford, Ryan Gosling, Ana de Armas
overview: Young Blade Runner K's discovery of a long-buried secret leads him to track down former Blade Runner Rick Deckard, who's been missing for thirty years.

stars: Dean-Charles Chapman, George MacKay, Daniel Mays
overview: April 6th, 1917. As an infantry battalion assembles to wage war deep in enemy territory, two soldiers are assigned to race against time and deliver a message that will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
overview: As Harry, Ron, and Hermione race against time and evil to destroy the Horcruxes, they uncover the existence of the three most powerful objects in the wizarding world: the Deathly Hallows.

title: Troy
stars: Brad Pitt, Eric Bana, Orlando Bloom
overview: An adaptation of Homer's great epic, the film follows the assault on Troy by the united Greek forces and chronicles the fates of the men involved.

title: The Great Gatsby
stars: Leonardo DiCaprio, Carey Mulligan, Joel Edgerton
overview: A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
stars: James Franco, Andy Serkis, Freida Pinto
overview: A substance designed to help the brain repair itself gives advanced intelligence to a chimpanzee who leads an ape uprising.

title: Ex Machina
stars: Alicia Vikander, Domhnall Gleeson, Oscar Isaac
overview: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
stars: Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, Rupert Grint
overview: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

title: Captain Marvel
stars: Ryan Fleck, Brie Larson, Samuel L. Jackson
overview: Carol Danvers becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races.

title: Zodiac
stars: Jake Gyllenhaal, Robert Downey Jr., Mark Ruffalo
overview: Between 1968 and 1983, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.

title: Juno
stars: Elliot Page, Michael Cera, Jennifer Garner

title: Oblivion
stars: Tom Cruise, Morgan Freeman, Andrea Riseborough
overview: A veteran assigned to extract Earth's remaining resources begins to question what he knows about his mission and himself.

title: Nightcrawler
stars: Jake Gyllenhaal, Rene Russo, Bill Paxton

title: Source Code
stars: Jake Gyllenhaal, Michelle Monaghan, Vera Farmiga
overview: A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
stars: Johnny Depp, Penélope Cruz, Ian McShane
overview: Jack Sparrow and Barbossa embark on a quest to find the elusive fountain of youth, only to discover that Blackbeard and his daughter are after it too.

stars: Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage
overview: Bilbo and company are forced to engage in a war against an array of combatants and keep the Lonely Mountain from falling into the hands of a rising darkness.

stars: Patrick Stewart, Hugh Jackman, Halle Berry

title: Baby Driver
stars: Ansel Elgort, Jon Bernthal, Jon Hamm

title: A Quiet Place
stars: Emily Blunt, John Krasinski, Millicent Simmonds
overview: In a post-apocalyptic world, a family is forced to live in silence while hiding from monsters with ultra-sensitive hearing.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
stars: Logan Lerman, Emma Watson, Ezra Miller
overview: An introvert freshman is taken under the wings of two seniors who welcome him to the real world.

title: Hot Fuzz
stars: Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, Martin Freeman
overview: A skilled London police officer, after irritating superiors with his embarrassing effectiveness, is transferred to a village where the easygoing officers object to his fervor for regulations, as a string of grisly murders strikes the town.

title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
stars: Hugh Jackman, Liev Schreiber, Ryan Reynolds

stars: Lilly Wachowski, Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne

stars: Will Smith, Thandiwe Newton, Jaden Smith

title: The Conjuring
stars: Patrick Wilson, Vera Farmiga, Ron Livingston

title: Star Trek Into Darkness
stars: Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Zoe Saldana
overview: After the crew of the Enterprise find an unstoppable force of terror from within their own organization, Captain Kirk leads a manhunt to a war-zone world to capture a one-man weapon of mass destruction.

title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith

title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
stars: Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg

title: Lucy
stars: Scarlett Johansson, Morgan Freeman, Choi Min-sik

title: Zootopia

title: Love Actually
stars: Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Liam Neeson

title: Hancock
stars: Will Smith, Charlize Theron, Jason Bateman
overview: Hancock is a superhero whose ill-considered behavior regularly causes damage in the millions. He changes when the person he saves helps him improve his public image.

title: The Incredible Hulk
stars: Edward Norton, Liv Tyler, Tim Roth
overview: Bruce Banner, a scientist on the run from the U.S. Government, must find a cure for the monster he turns into whenever he loses his temper.

title: American Sniper
stars: Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller, Kyle Gallner

title: Split
stars: James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy, Haley Lu Richardson

title: Little Miss Sunshine
stars: Valerie Faris, Steve Carell, Toni Collette

title: Rush
stars: Daniel Brühl, Chris Hemsworth, Olivia Wilde

title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2
stars: Andrew Garfield, Emma Stone, Jamie Foxx
overview: When New York is put under siege by Oscorp, it is up to Spider-Man to save the city he swore to protect as well as his loved ones.

title: Fury
stars: Brad Pitt, Shia LaBeouf, Logan Lerman

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
stars: Johnny Depp, Freddie Highmore, David Kelly
overview: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

title: Warrior
stars: Tom Hardy, Nick Nolte, Joel Edgerton

stars: Peter Ramsey, Rodney Rothman, Shameik Moore

stars: Matt Damon, Franka Potente, Joan Allen

title: Coco
stars: Adrian Molina, Anthony Gonzalez, Gael García Bernal

title: Spotlight
stars: Mark Ruffalo, Michael Keaton, Rachel McAdams

title: The Wolverine
stars: Hugh Jackman, Will Yun Lee, Tao Okamoto
overview: Wolverine comes to Japan to meet an old friend whose life he saved years ago, and gets embroiled in a conspiracy involving yakuza and mutants.

title: Twilight
stars: Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Billy Burke
overview: When Bella Swan moves to a small town in the Pacific Northwest, she falls in love with Edward Cullen, a mysterious classmate who reveals himself to be a 108-year-old vampire.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
stars: Daniel Craig, Rooney Mara, Christopher Plummer
overview: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist is aided in his search for a woman who has been missing for forty years by Lisbeth Salander, a young computer hacker.

title: Kung Fu Panda
stars: John Stevenson, Jack Black, Ian McShane

stars: Shailene Woodley, Theo James, Kate Winslet

stars: Dylan O'Brien, Kaya Scodelario, Will Poulter

title: Venom
stars: Tom Hardy, Michelle Williams, Riz Ahmed
overview: A failed reporter is bonded to an alien entity, one of many symbiotes who have invaded Earth. But the being takes a liking to Earth and decides to protect it.

title: Shrek 2
stars: Kelly Asbury, Conrad Vernon, Mike Myers
overview: Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.

title: Mystic River
stars: Sean Penn, Tim Robbins, Kevin Bacon
overview: The lives of three men who were childhood friends are shattered when one of them has a family tragedy.

title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
stars: Harrison Ford, Cate Blanchett, Shia LaBeouf
overview: In 1957, archaeologist and adventurer Dr. Henry "Indiana" Jones, Jr. is called back into action and becomes entangled in a Soviet plot to uncover the secret behind mysterious artifacts known as the Crystal Skulls.

title: Green Book
stars: Viggo Mortensen, Mahershala Ali, Linda Cardellini

title: Sherlock Holmes: A Game of Shadows
stars: Robert Downey Jr., Jude Law, Jared Harris
overview: Detective Sherlock Holmes is on the trail of criminal mastermind Professor Moriarty, who is carrying out a string of random crimes across Europe.

title: The Hurt Locker
stars: Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie, Brian Geraghty
overview: During the Iraq War, a Sergeant recently assigned to an army bomb squad is put at odds with his squad mates due to his maverick way of handling his work.

title: Lost in Translation
stars: Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson, Giovanni Ribisi
overview: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.

title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
stars: Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston, Alison Sudol
overview: The adventures of writer Newt Scamander in New York's secret community of witches and wizards seventy years before Harry Potter reads his book in school.

title: Big Hero 6
stars: Chris Williams, Ryan Potter, Scott Adsit
overview: A special bond develops between plus-sized inflatable robot Baymax and prodigy Hiro Hamada, who together team up with a group of friends to form a band of high-tech heroes.

title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1

overview: Katniss Everdeen is in District 13 after she shatters the games forever. Under the leadership of President Coin and the advice of her trusted friends, Katniss spreads her wings as she fights to save Peeta and a nation moved by her courage.

title: The Terminal

title: Horrible Bosses
stars: Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis

overview: An alien invasion threatens the future of humanity. The catastrophic nightmare is depicted through the eyes of one American family fighting for survival.

stars: Ben Affleck, Gal Gadot, Jason Momoa

title: Big Fish
stars: Ewan McGregor, Albert Finney, Billy Crudup

stars: Adam Sandler, Burt Reynolds, Chris Rock

overview: The crypto-zoological agency Monarch faces off against a battery of god-sized monsters, including the mighty Godzilla, who collides with Mothra, Rodan, and his ultimate nemesis, the three-headed King Ghidorah.

overview: The story of Harvey Milk and his struggles as an American gay activist who fought for gay rights and became California's first openly gay elected official.

title: Legend

title: Inferno
stars: Tom Hanks, Felicity Jones, Irrfan Khan

overview: A malfunctioning time machine at a ski resort takes a man back to 1986 with his two friends and nephew, where they must relive a fateful night and not change anything to make sure the nephew is born.

title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
stars: Keanu Reeves, Jennifer Connelly, Kathy Bates
overview: A remake of the 1951 classic science fiction film about an alien visitor and his giant robot counterpart who visit Earth.

title: The Heat
stars: Sandra Bullock, Michael McDonald, Melissa McCarthy

title: Alexander
stars: Colin Farrell, Anthony Hopkins, Rosario Dawson

title: The Age of Adaline

title: RED 2
stars: Bruce Willis, Helen Mirren, John Malkovich
overview: Retired CIA agent Frank Moses reunites his unlikely team of elite operatives for a global quest to track down a missing portable nuclear device.

title: Incendies
stars: Lubna Azabal, Mélissa Désormeaux-Poulin, Maxim Gaudette

title: Terminator: Dark Fate
stars: Linda Hamilton, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Mackenzie Davis

title: Hitman

stars: Jason Bateman, Jason Sudeikis, Charlie Day
overview: Dale, Kurt and Nick decide to start their own business but things don't go as planned because of a slick investor, prompting the trio to pull off a harebrained and misguided kidnapping scheme.

title: The Hills Have Eyes
stars: Ted Levine, Kathleen Quinlan, Dan Byrd
overview: A traveling family falls victim to a group of mutated cannibals in a desert far away from civilization.

title: The Master
stars: Philip Seymour Hoffman, Joaquin Phoenix, Amy Adams

title: Beowulf
stars: Ray Winstone, Crispin Glover, Angelina Jolie
overview: The warrior Beowulf must fight and defeat the monster Grendel, who is terrorizing Denmark, then Grendel's Mother, who begins killing out of revenge.

title: Team America: World Police

stars: Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Barbara Hershey

title: Contratiempo
stars: Mario Casas, Ana Wagener, Jose Coronado

stars: Taron Egerton, Jamie Bell, Richard Madden

title: The Perfect Storm
stars: George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, John C. Reilly

title: The Meg
stars: Jason Statham, Bingbing Li, Rainn Wilson

title: Jai Bhim
stars: Suriya, Lijo Mol Jose, Manikandan
overview: When a tribal man is arrested for a case of alleged theft, his wife turns to a human-rights lawyer to help bring justice.

title: Deepwater Horizon

stars: Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker, Max von Sydow

stars: Ewan McGregor, Pierce Brosnan, Olivia Williams

title: Final Destination 2

stars: Steve Carell, Tina Fey, Mark Wahlberg

stars: Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Johnny Depp

stars: Robert Rodriguez, Mickey Rourke, Jessica Alba

stars: Emma Thompson, Tom Hanks, Annie Rose Buckley

title: Rampage

stars: Dwayne Johnson, Emily Blunt, Edgar Ramírez

stars: Jason Statham, Ben Foster, Donald Sutherland

stars: John Cho, Debra Messing, Joseph Lee

On a special trip outside the hive, Barry's life is saved by Vanessa, a florist in New York City. As their relationship blossoms, he discovers humans actually eat honey, and subsequently decides to sue them.

title: Marley & Me
stars: Owen Wilson, Jennifer Aniston, Eric Dane

title: Bridge to Terabithia
stars: Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel

title: The Old Guard
stars: Charlize Theron, KiKi Layne, Matthias Schoenaerts

title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
stars: Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders, Aldis Hodge

title: The Spectacular Now
stars: Miles Teller, Shailene Woodley, Kyle Chandler

title: Bad Boys for Life
stars: Bilall Fallah, Will Smith, Martin Lawrence

Along the way they encounter dragons, dwarves, merfolk, and a band of lost warriors before reaching the edge of the world.

title: The Equalizer 2
stars: Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal, Ashton Sanders
overview: Robert McCall serves an unflinching justice for the exploited and oppressed, but how far will he go when that is someone he loves?

title: The Drop

title: Pandorum

title: The Guest
